summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview with a BOP Lieutenant regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document lists numerous attachments including interview transcripts, assignment rosters, logs, and emails related to the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the OIG investigation, who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Leonardo Fernandez
persons.context: An inmate at MCC New York whose quarters history is included as an attachment to the investigation.

events.title: Epstein's last full day in custody
events.description: The day before Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive within his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: OIG interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview of a BOP Lieutenant regarding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.
A BOP Lieutenant was interviewed on August 4, 2021, regarding events surrounding Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The investigation includes extensive documentation such as daily assignment rosters, logs, count documentation, and email correspondence from July-August 2019.
The document contains 29 attachments including interview transcripts, prison records, and video evidence related to Epstein's death.
